result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Russell W. Spalding in court with attorney Stephen Richard Kramer.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Proposed Plea Agreement
Application for Jail Time Credit form

Defendant Russell W. Spalding in court with attorney Stephen Richard Kramer.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Transcript of Motion hearing before the Hon. Kristine E. Drettwan on November 30, 2016
Court Reporter:  Linda C. Matoska

9:04 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Russell W. Spalding in court with attorney Stephen Richard Kramer.  
Matter is before the Court for a Motion to Suppress that has been filed by the Defense.  
This was a warrantless search and the burden of proof is on the State.   
Atty Kramer moves to exclude witnesses.  Atty Kramer indicates that he was just given new reports  and a consent to search this morning and wants to make sure there are no other reports.  Atty Leusink indicates that it wasn't in the State's file.  Atty Leusink believes he has turned over everything to Attorney Kramer at his point.  Town of Geneva Officer Eric Anderson believes that everything has been turned over.  Atty Kramer is prepared to proceed today.  Court grants Motion to exclude witnesses;  
9:09 am  Officer Jason D. Sweeney is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Leusink.  

Marked, identified and received into evidence;  
Exhibit 1 - Town of Geneva PD consent to search;  

9:20 am  Cross exam by Atty Kramer.  
9:36 am  Redirect by Atty Leusink.  
9:38 am  Recross by Atty Kramer.  
9:38 am  Witness excused.  

9:38 am  Officer Eric Anderson is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Leusink.  
9:46 am  Cross exam by Atty Kramer.  
9:54 am  Witness excused.  
9:55 am  Deputy Daniel McKinney is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Leusink.  
9:59 am  Cross exam by Atty Kramer.  
10:08 am  Witness excused.  

10:09 am  Kathryn Spalding is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Kramer.  
10:26 am  Cross exam by Atty Leusink.  
10:32 am  Witness excused.  

10:33 am  Atty Kramer will be calling Mr. Spalding to testify.  Court has a 10:30 am sentencing hearing on another case and proposes that this motion hearing be continued to a new date.  Atty Kramer agrees.  Court schedules continued Motion hearing date for December 22nd at 9:30 a.m. (2.5 hours reserved).  Atty Kramer provides Court with copy of case law (Randolph).  Court asks that any response be filed by December 16th.  

10:36 am  Court in recess.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Russell W. Spalding in court, in custody via video with attorney Francis Raff for attorney Stephen Richard Kramer.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond Forfeited. Minutes filed.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 16CF305, 15CF384 & 16GF816
NO STEROIDS PROHIBITED BY LAW
Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH K.B-S. EXCEPT FOR TELEPHONE CONTACT TO DISCUSS THEIR CHILD & CONTACT WITH REGARD TO CHILD AT HOSPITAL.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Signed bond filed with the court.
NO CONTACT MODIFIED TO ALLOW TELEPHONE CONTACT TO DISCUSS THEIR CHILD & ALLOW CONTACT WITH K.B-S. WITH REGARD TO CHILD AT HOSPITAL.
